frameDefinitions: An Agent or a Cause mentally or physically expends energy rendering an Input, whether implicit or explicit, into a Output.
A Text is an entity that contains linguistic, symbolic information on a Topic, created by an Author at the Time_of_creation.
An Agent, which may be an individual or group, is engaged in a complex Activity.
Two (or more) people (the Parties, also encodable as Party_1 and Party_2) have an agreement.
A Cognizer has carried out an approximate calculation or considered some Evidence and produced an approximation of the Value of a feature of an Item.
frameExamples: Erosion is the <t>work</t> of wind and water on rock.
The New Car Assessment <t>Program</t> (NCAP) is dedicated to helping the public buy a safer car.
The US and Russia have an <t>agreement</t> to share early warning data on missile launches.
You can list a <t><fex name='Value'>ballpark figure</fex></t> for shipping and handling.
listRoleDefinitions: A sentient entity whose physical and mental faculties are directly expended on the <fen>Input</fen> to create the <fen>Output</fen>.
A non-sentient entity whose physical faculties are directly expended on the <fen>Input</fen> to create the <fen>Output</fen>.
The mental or physical faculties onto which the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> expends energy.
The end product, either a concept or physical object onto which the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> has exerted its mental or physical faculties from the rudimentary state of <fen>Input</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Output</fen> was committed into reality.
The place where the <fen>Output</fen> was birthed.
The <fen>Text</fen> is the entity that contains linguistic information. This an incorporated role for each LU in this frame.
The region where the <fen>Text</fen> is sold, circulated, or otherwise popular.
The individual or organization that carries out the project.
An area of human endeavor, typically scientifc in nature, in which the <fen>Agent</fen>'s <fen>Activity</fen> falls.
What the <fen>Agent</fen> (an individual or the members of an organization) are dedicated to doing.
The larger aim that the <fen>Agent</fen> is pursuing by carrying out certain coordinated measures.
An entity (abstract or concrete) which is involved in an implicit <fen>Activity</fen>.
The ongoing plan of action which allows the <fen>Agent</fen> to pursue the <fen>Activity</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Project</fen> is ongoing.
The location where a <fen>Project</fen> is pursued.

The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i.e. agentive) party of the agreement, as compared with <fen>Party_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Party_1</fen> is generally encoded as the External Argument of verbs, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Party_1</fen>. Thus <fen>Manner</fen> is construed to be that of <fen>Party_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Party_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Parties</fen> as a whole.
The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent participant (or group of participants) in the agreement. It is generally encoded within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by with).
An expression of the commitment of the <fen>Parties</fen> .
<fen>Topic</fen> is a description of the domain covered by the agreement.
The group of individuals portrayed as equally involved in having an agreement.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the agreement was made.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an agreement was made.
The individual who has considered evidence or performed calculations to produce the approximation.
The position or area  on the feature scale that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has concluded the <fen>Item</fen> occupies.
The entity that possesses a feature whose <fen>Value</fen> the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has approximated.
A proposition expressing the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s approximation of a feature's <fen>Value</fen>.
An open proposition for which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has approximated the <fen>Value</fen> of a variable.
The time period during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> formed the estimate.
The location in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has formed their estimate.
listRoleExamples: The <fex>DOE</fex> Human Genome Program also has developed high-throughput approaches to identifying is-regulatory sequences in the human and other genomes
Several projects <fex>in computational linguistics</fex> have recently stalled due to lack of funding .
The <fex>New Car Assessment</fex> Program (NCAP) is dedicated to helping the public buy a safer car.
The program <fex>to analyze the composition of Titan's sludge</fex> is nearly complete.
Iran has vowed to continue its <fex>nuclear</fex> program and is demanding that sanctions against it should be lifted .
<fex>AOL 's</fex> agreement with the ACLU will soon expire , and renogotiation is not a real possibility .
Mozilla Foundation now has a bindingagreement <fex>with America Online</fex>.
The US and Russia have an agreement <fex>to share early warning data on missile launches</fex>.
Some types of alloy steel have been covered in the expiring <fex>trade</fex> agreement.
<fex>The US and Russia</fex> have an agreement to cooperate in destroying surplus portable anti-aircraft missiles.
The missile agreement <fex>of 1952</fex> was still in force, however.
The <fex>Kyoto</fex> treaty has so far been relatively ineffectual.
<fex>Her</fex> estimation was that they had exported up to 180000 fish.
Sotheby 's estimate of its value was <fex>$10m-$14m</fex>.
He's an engineer and he is supposed to know the estimate <fex>of the house</fex>.
One estimate was <fex>that eventually I had lost about 80% of my blood</fex>.

Galliard decided Rwanda was different, and he went public with his estimate
<fex>of how many people had been killed in a matter of two weeks</fex>.
That is 30000 higher than <fex>last year's</fex> estimate of 2.65 million
